narratives.narrative_name: URW: Blaming the war on others rather than the invader
narratives.evidence_quote: Sadly the western media is framing the war as if Russia is losing which only prolongs negotiations and causes more death. The question is, why the desperation to keep the war going?
narratives.reasoning: This quote shifts blame for the prolongation of the war and resulting deaths onto Western media and implied Western actions, rather than attributing responsibility to Russia as the invader.

narratives.evidence_quote: amerikans are the greatest pigs on the planet…and that is in the most derogitive term you can imagine.. absolute pigs
narratives.reasoning: The text uses highly inflammatory and derogatory language to criticize Americans and, by extension, Western countries, undermining their moral standing and diplomacy.
This phrase directly attacks Western media and, by implication, Western institutions, portraying them as manipulative and untrustworthy.

narratives.evidence_quote: Sadly the western media is framing the war as if Russia is losing which only prolongs negotiations and causes more death.
narratives.reasoning: This statement questions the reliability and integrity of Western media, suggesting it is spreading a false narrative to manipulate public perception.

narratives.evidence_quote: information that you are missing from the corporation propaganda western media
narratives.reasoning: This quote explicitly labels Western media as 'propaganda' and implies it is withholding or distorting information, fostering distrust in media sources.

narratives.evidence_quote: for the west it’s always been the soviet (RUSSIAN) that has ALWAYS been the boogie man..when in fact they were SELDOM a threat
narratives.reasoning: This statement portrays Russia as unfairly targeted and vilified by the West, framing it as a victim of historical and ongoing Western hostility.

narratives.evidence_quote: Will they resort to nuclear weapons to even out the war?...lets get on with a full nuke war…wipe us all out
narratives.reasoning: The text evokes fear and anxiety by speculating about the use of nuclear weapons and the catastrophic consequences of a full-scale nuclear war.

narratives.narrative_name: URW: Negative Consequences for the West
narratives.reasoning: This quote predicts or implies severe negative consequences for Western populations due to the actions of their governments, framing it as a deserved outcome.
The title of the text explicitly praises Russia by asserting its military success in the conflict, positively highlighting its actions.

subnarratives.subnarrative_name: URW: Blaming the war on others rather than the invader: The West are the aggressors
subnarratives.evidence_quote: for the west it’s always been the soviet (RUSSIAN) that has ALWAYS been the boogie man..when in fact they were SELDOM a threat.. amerika always blew any comment about RUSSIA or at later stages CHINA way out of proportion.. and you are still doing …for me …,a poor western subject.. I have NEVER agreed with you..in fact you have NEVER asked me my thoughts ….oh sorry I was / am just your cannon fodder …I do not count…
subnarratives.reasoning: This quote explicitly shifts blame to the West, portraying it as the historical aggressor that exaggerates threats from Russia and treats its own citizens as expendable. This aligns with the subnarrative of blaming the West for the conflict rather than the invader (Russia).

subnarratives.subnarrative_name: URW: Blaming the war on others rather than the invader: Other
subnarratives.evidence_quote: time to stop caring about the people that do not care..they are the enemy of one sort or the other.. time they took responsibility (rather than consequences) of what their politicians are doing in their name.. Scott Ritter ..good topics ..talking the truth..yes but where is what he says getting us …seems nowhere ..lets get on with a full nuke war…wipe us all out …at least it (for most) will be over quickly and no more of month after month of promises from Trump or threats from the east….POOF..it’s all over …thanks mostly to un-elected bureaucrats in all “western countries” they are proving the worst of the worst of humanity
subnarratives.reasoning: This passage supports the parent narrative by blaming Western bureaucrats and politicians for prolonging the war and escalating tensions, but it does not fit neatly into the specific subnarratives of 'Ukraine is the aggressor' or 'The West are the aggressors.' Instead, it frames the West as the primary culprit for global suffering, which is a distinct argument within the broader theme of deflecting blame from Russia.

subnarratives.subnarrative_name: URW: Discrediting the West, Diplomacy: The EU is divided
subnarratives.evidence_quote: un-elected bureaucrats in all 'western countries' they are proving the worst of the worst of humanity
subnarratives.reasoning: The quote criticizes Western countries collectively, implying they are governed by a disconnected elite, which aligns with the subnarrative of presenting the EU (and West) as internally fractured and unable to act cohesively.

subnarratives.subnarrative_name: URW: Discrediting the West, Diplomacy: The West is weak
subnarratives.evidence_quote: Russia is Winning, Nuclear Threat is a Sign of Desperation & Very Serious
subnarratives.reasoning: The title and framing of the interview suggest that the West's position is deteriorating, portraying it as desperate and thus weak in the face of Russia's actions.

subnarratives.subnarrative_name: URW: Discrediting the West, Diplomacy: The West is overreacting
subnarratives.evidence_quote: amerika always blew any comment about RUSSIA or at later stages CHINA way out of proportion.. and you are still doing
subnarratives.reasoning: This quote explicitly accuses the West of exaggerating threats from Russia and China, fitting the subnarrative of portraying Western reactions as disproportionate.

I have NEVER agreed with you..in fact you have NEVER asked me my thoughts ….oh sorry I was / am just your cannon fodder …I do not count

subnarratives.subnarrative_name: URW: Discrediting the West, Diplomacy: Diplomacy does/will not work

subnarratives.reasoning: This quote implies that Western media's portrayal of the war undermines diplomatic efforts, suggesting that diplomacy is ineffective or doomed to fail.

subnarratives.subnarrative_name: URW: Discrediting the West, Diplomacy: West is tired of Ukraine
subnarratives.evidence_quote: lets get on with a full nuke war…wipe us all out …at least it (for most) will be over quickly and no more of month after month of promises from Trump or threats from the east
subnarratives.reasoning: The quote reflects a sense of exhaustion and frustration with prolonged Western involvement in Ukraine, suggesting the West is fatigued and disinterested in continuing support.

subnarratives.subnarrative_name: URW: Amplifying war-related fears: There is a real possibility that nuclear weapons will be employed
subnarratives.evidence_quote: Will they resort to nuclear weapons to even out the war? ... lets get on with a full nuke war…wipe us all out …at least it (for most) will be over quickly
subnarratives.reasoning: The text explicitly raises the specter of nuclear weapons being used, evoking fear and anxiety about their potential employment. The phrase 'full nuke war' and the acceptance of mass destruction as a possible outcome directly align with the subnarrative's definition.

subnarratives.subnarrative_name: URW: Amplifying war-related fears: Russia will also attack other countries
subnarratives.evidence_quote: the horrors left behind of Russia China`Britain (lots of europe) amerika canada australia NZ
subnarratives.reasoning: The text implies that Russia (alongside China) will extend its destructive reach beyond Ukraine to other countries, including Western nations. This suggests an imminent or inevitable expansion of conflict, fitting the subnarrative's definition.
